question: In some countries,  owning a home rather than renting one is very important  for people.Why might this be the case ?  Do you think this a positive or negative situation ?
text: Selecting a place to live in is a big decision to make. In some parts of the world, people value for their own housing because it gives them a sense of achievement rather than renting which could not save money. From my perspective, house ownership is a natural human desire.

To begin with, many individuals  seek to own their personal house where they could live with peace of mind. Many people have a tendency to have their own residence rather than renting a place to live, although they may struggle and even face hardships to acquire it. In many Western countries, for instance,  people mortgage and take bank loans for their personal housing. Whereas, a tenant not only have to abide the landlord's rules and regulations, but also they have no privilege to renovate according to his need. Thus, it is imperative to owe a personal house where one can live peacefully without the interventions of other.

Nonetheless, I believe that home ownership has many positive aspects such as it gives freedom, an individual does not bind to any rules and he has the opportunity to renovate frequently. Taking myself as an example, when I was living in Auburn, Sydney, I cannot even move a sofa set to another room from the drawing room, though personal accommodation is necessary to thrive in a society.  Furthermore, the sense of satisfaction can be felt in own shelter, while living as a tenant one could not be satisfied because he has to follow strict regulations. So, having personal accommodation will make you feel more relaxed. Hence, owning a home gives a sense of satisfaction and fulfilment.

To sum up, a place to live depends on the dwellers either if they live as a tenant or having his own flat. However, renting could not save finances while home ownership can save money in the longer perspective.
